intro: Ardisia macrosepala, commonly known as the large-sepal ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a bright red, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds. Ardisia macrosepala is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
